intro: Dorstenia carautae, commonly known as the Carauta false vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its unique, spiraling stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Dorstenia carautae is often grown as a curiosity in botanical gardens due to its unusual growth habit and ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
